N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4054.12 - Allowances in overnight flat race

State Regulations

In all overnight flat races, except handicaps, run
under this Article, jockeys or amateur riders who have never ridden a winner on
the flat allowed seven pounds; non-winners of five races on the flat allowed
three pounds, if such allowance be claimed at the hour of closing of entries. In stakes (handicaps excepted) closing more than three days prior to the day
they are to be run, these allowances may be claimed up to 24 hours before the
race. These allowances cannot be waived except by permission of the stewards
and only for a reason in keeping with the best interests of
racing. Notes
